alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Alleghany, northern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina and southern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nella, or over Whitetop, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sparta... Jefferson... Independence... Lansing... Laurel Springs... Whitetop... and Mouth Of Wilson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
